title: Uganda: Inflation Rises to 5.4 Percent in July
text:
East Africa: Regional Industrialists Step Up Fight Against Illicit Trade 
Mukiiza however said although the inflation rate rose, the price for food in the reviewed year (July 2015) decreased by 5.9 compared to 6.1 % recorded in June 2015. 
On a monthly basis the country's headline inflation rose by 0.4% from the 0.9% decrease recorded in June 2015 and this was also driven by increase in prices of fuel Energy and other Utilities. 
In the month of June the country experienced an increase in the prices of fuel at the local market which fuel dealers attributed to the depreciating Uganda currency against international currencies like as United states dollar which is majorly used in the purchase of fuel from a neigbouring country by Uganda's fuel dealers. 
Because of the depreciating Uganda shilling, the energy regulators Uganda Energy Regulatory Authority have been compelled to hike power tariffs in the country. 
Assessing the performance by centres, Mukiiza said Masaka in western Uganda had the highest inflation of 6.8% due to increase in food prices transport and foot wear followed by Kampala's Middle and Lower Income whose inflation stood at 6.6% compared to 5.1 % registered in June 2015. However Arua in northwest Uganda had the lowest rate among the centers the agency surveyed. Uganda
